member.name: T:S22.Imap.AuthMethod
member.summary: Defines supported means of authenticating with an IMAP server.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.Auto

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.Login
member.summary: Login using plaintext password authentication; This is supported by most servers.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.Plain
member.summary: Login using the SASL PLAIN authentication mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.CramMd5
member.summary: Login using the CRAM-MD5 authentication mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.DigestMd5
member.summary: Login using the DIGEST-MD5 authentication mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.OAuth
member.summary: Login using OAuth via the SASL XOAuth mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.OAuth2
member.summary: Login using OAuth 2.0 via the SASL XOAUTH2 mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.Ntlm
member.summary: Login using the NTLM authentication mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.Ntlmv2
member.summary: Login using the NTLMv2 authentication mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.NtlmOverSspi
member.summary: Login using the NTLM/NTLMv2 authentication mechanism via Microsoft's Security Support Provider Interface (SSPI).

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.Gssapi
member.summary: Login using Kerberos authentication via the SASL GSSAPI mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.ScramSha1
member.summary: Login using the SCRAM-SHA-1 authentication mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.AuthMethod.Srp
member.summary: Login using the Secure Remote Password (SRP) authentication mechanism.
member.remarks: The SRP mechanism is only available when targeting .NET 4.0 or newer.

member.name: T:S22.Imap.Auth.FilterStream
member.summary: A filter stream sitting between Negotiate- and NetworkStream to enable managed NTLM/GSSAPI authentication.
member.remarks:
We use a filter for hooking into the NegotiateStream protocol rather than p/invoking SSPI directly as that would require unmanaged code privileges (internally NegotiateStream uses an SSPI wrapper).
NegotiateStream - FilterStream - NetworkStream.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.Auth.Sasl.SaslMechanism.GetResponse(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the base64-encoded client response for the specified base64-encoded challenge sent by the server.
member.param: A base64-encoded string representing a challenge sent by the server.
member.returns: A base64-encoded string representing the client response to the server challenge.
member.remarks: The IMAP, POP3 and SMTP authentication commands expect challenges and responses to be base64-encoded. This method automatically decodes the server challenge before passing it to the Sasl implementation and encodes the client response to a base64-string before returning it to the caller.
member.exception: Thrown if the client response could not be retrieved. Refer to the inner exception for error details.

member.name: T:S22.Imap.Auth.Sasl.Mechanisms.SaslSrp
member.summary: Implements the Sasl Secure Remote Password (SRP) authentication mechanism as is described in the IETF SRP 08 draft.
member.remarks:
This requires .NET Framework 4 because it makes use of the System.Numeric namespace which has only been part of .NET since version 4.
Some notes: - Don't bother with the example given in the IETF 08 draft document (7.5 Example); It is broken. - Integrity and confidentiality protection is not implemented. In fact, the "mandatory"-option is not supported at all.

member.name: T:S22.Imap.ContentType
member.summary: Possible values for the "Type" property of the Bodypart class. For a detailed description of MIME Media Types refer to RFC 2046.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.ContentType.Text
member.summary: The "text" media type is intended for sending material which is principally textual in form.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.ContentType.Image
member.summary: A media type of "image" indicates that the body contains an image. The subtype names the specific image format.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.ContentType.Audio
member.summary: A media type of "audio" indicates that the body contains audio data.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.ContentType.Video
member.summary: A media type of "video" indicates that the body contains a time-varying-picture image, possibly with color and coordinated sound.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.ContentType.Application
member.summary: The "application" media type is to be used for discrete data which do not fit in any of the other categories, and particularly for data to be processed by some type of application program.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.ContentType.Message
member.summary: The "message" content type allows messages to contain other messages or pointers to other messages.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.ContentType.Other
member.summary: The media type value is unknown or could not be determined.

member.summary: Retrieves the mail message, but will only download content that has a content-type of text. This will retrieve text as well as HTML representation, while skipping inline content and attachments.

member.summary: Retrieves the mail message, but skips any content that is an attachment.

member.name: T:S22.Imap.MailboxFlag
member.summary: Defines possible attributes for mailboxes.

remarks.para: An IMAP mailbox can have a number of flags (read: attributes) set on it, indicating its designated purpose (such as "Spam" or "Drafts").

This is especially convenient when dealing with international mailbox names, because, by examining the associated flags, the mailbox purpose can be determined, even if the mailbox name provides no useful indication.
Unfortunately, as with many things IMAP, reporting the flags described here is an optional extension (XLIST) to the IMAP protocol and as such may or may not be supported by an IMAP server.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.MailboxFlag.AllMail
member.summary: The mailbox presents a view on all messages in the user's message store.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.MailboxFlag.Archive
member.summary: The mailbox is used to archive messages. The meaning of an "archival" mailbox is server dependent.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.MailboxFlag.Drafts
member.summary: The mailbox is used to hold draft messages, typically these are messages that are being composed but have not yet been sent.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.MailboxFlag.Sent
member.summary: The mailbox is used to hold copies of messages that have been sent.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.MailboxFlag.Spam

member.name: T:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension

member.returns: A NameValueCollection representing the RFC822/MIME mail header fields.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension.ImportanceMap
member.summary: A map for mapping the values of the MailPriority enumeration to their corresponding MIME importance values as defined in RFC2156.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension.To822Address(System.Net.Mail.MailAddress)
member.summary: Creates an address string from the specified MailAddress instance in compliance with the address specification as outlined in RFC2822 under section 3.4
member.param: The MailAddress instance to create the address string from.
member.returns: An address string as is used in RFC822 mail headers.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension.GenerateContentBoundary
member.summary: Generates a unique sequence of characters for indicating a boundary between parts in a multipart message.
member.returns: A unique content boundary string.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension.BuildBody(System.Net.Mail.MailMessage,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Builds an RFC822/MIME-compliant mail body from the specified MailMessage instance and returns it as a formatted string.
member.param: The MailMessage instance to build the mail body from.
The RFC822/MIME mail header to use for constructing the mail body.
member.returns: An RFC822/MIME-compliant mail body as a string.
member.remarks: According to RFC2822 each line of a mail message should at max be 78 characters in length excluding carriage return and newline characters. This method accounts for that and ensures line breaks are inserted to meet this requirement.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension.AddBody(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Net.Mail.MailMessage,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a body part to the specified Stringbuilder object composed from the Body and BodyEncoding properties of the MailMessage class.
member.param: The Stringbuilder to append the body part to.
The MailMessage instance to build the body part from.
The RFC822/MIME mail header to use for constructing the mail body.
Set to true to append body headers before adding the actual body part content.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension.AddAttachment(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase)
member.summary: Creates a MIME body part from an entry of the AlternateView or Attachments collection of a MailMessage instance and appends it to the specified Stringbuilder instance.
member.param: The Stringbuilder instance to append the body part to.
An entry from either the AlternateView or the Attachments collection of a MailMessage instance.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension.AddNestedAlternative(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Net.Mail.MailMessage,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Creates a nested multipart/alternative part which contains all entries from the AlternateViews collection of the specified MailMessage instance as well as the body part for the Body and BodyEncoding properties of the specified MailMessage instance.
member.param: The StringBuilder instance to append to.
The MailMessage instance whose AlternateView collection will be added to the nested multipart/alternative part.
The RFC822/MIME mail header to use for constructing the mail body.
member.remarks: This is used if the MailMessage instance contains both alternative views and attachments. In this case the created RFC822/MIME mail message will contain nested body parts.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.MailMessageExtension.AddNestedMixed(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Net.Mail.MailMessage)
member.summary: Creates a nested multipart/mixed part which contains all entries from the Attachments collection of the specified MailMessage instance.
member.param: The StringBuilder instance to append to.
The MailMessage instance whose Attachments collection will be added to the nested multipart/mixed part.
member.remarks: This is used if the MailMessage instance contains both alternative views and attachments. In this case the created RFC822/MIME mail message will contain nested body parts.

member.param: The header field to parse.
member.returns: A NameValueCollection containing the parameter names as keys with the respective parameter values as values.

member.summary: Sent by the client in the Type 1 message to indicate that the client workstation's name is included in the message. This is used by the server to determine whether the client is eligible for local authentication.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.Auth.Sasl.Mechanisms.Ntlm.Flags.NegotiateLocalCall
member.summary: Sent by the server to indicate that the server and client are on the same machine. Implies that the client may use the established local credentials for authentication instead of calculating a response to the challenge.

member.name: F:S22.Imap.Auth.Sasl.Mechanisms.Ntlm.Flags.NegotiateAlwaysSign
member.summary: Indicates that authenticated communication between the client and server should be signed with a "dummy" signature.

member.param: The MIME parameter value to decode.
member.returns: The decoded MIME parameter value.
member.exception: The specified value is not a valid Rfc2231-encoded string.
member.remarks: Refer to RFC2231 for the details of the encoding mechanism.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.Util.Base64Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Takes a Base64-encoded string and decodes it.
member.param: The Base64-encoded string to decode.
member.returns: A byte array containing the Base64-decoded bytes of the input string.
member.exception: The value parameter is null.

The length of value, ignoring white-space characters, is not zero or a multiple of 4, or the format of value is invalid, or the value contains a non-base-64 character, more than two padding characters, or a non-white space-character among the padding characters.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.Util.UTF7Encode(System.String)
member.summary: Takes a UTF-16 encoded string and encodes it as modified UTF-7.
member.param: The string to encode.
member.returns: A UTF-7 encoded string
member.remarks: IMAP uses a modified version of UTF-7 for encoding international mailbox names. For details, refer to RFC 3501 section 5.1.3 (Mailbox International Naming Convention).

member.name: M:S22.Imap.Util.UTF7Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Takes a modified UTF-7 encoded string and decodes it.
member.param: The UTF-7 encoded string to decode.
member.returns: A UTF-16 encoded "standard" C# string
member.exception: The input string is not a properly UTF-7 encoded string.
member.remarks: IMAP uses a modified version of UTF-7 for encoding international mailbox names. For details, refer to RFC 3501 section 5.1.3 (Mailbox International Naming Convention).

member.name: M:S22.Imap.Util.GetEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: This just wraps Encoding.GetEncoding in a try-catch block to ensure it never fails. If the encoding can not be determined ASCII is returned as a default.
member.param: The code page name of the preferred encoding. Any value returned by System.Text.Encoding.WebName is a valid input.
member.returns: The System.Text.Encoding associated with the specified code page or Encoding.ASCII if the specified code page could not be resolved.

member.name: M:S22.Imap.Util.BuildSequenceSet(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Converts the specified enumerable collection of UIDs into an IMAP sequence-set.
member.param: An enumerable collection of UIDs.
member.returns: An IMAP sequence-set suitable for use with IMAP commands.
member.exception: The uids parameter is null.
The specified collection of UIDs is empty.
member.remarks: Refer to RFC3501, 9.Formal Syntax "sequence-set" for a description of IMAP sequence-sets.
